definition: to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: She tries to back track, but the President simply walks away.
sentences.chinese: 她试图重新回到话题，但总统一言不发地走开了。

sentences.english: He snorted indignantly and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 他气愤地哼了一声，走开了。

sentences.english: She is a great fool for going away, if she liked him.
sentences.chinese: 要是她喜欢他而又走开，那真是个大傻瓜呢。

sentences.english: Turned free and easy of go away, let figure burger in your mind.
sentences.chinese: 转身洒脱的走开，让你的头脑中留下美图汉堡的印象。

sentences.english: But, to his dismay, the donkey walks away.
sentences.chinese: 但是，使他惊愕的是，那头驴走开了。

sentences.english: Then, she walks away, her job done.
sentences.chinese: 然后她会走开，她的使命完成了。

sentences.english: Ying falsely claim is the waiter here, then panic away.
sentences.chinese: 珠英谎称自己是这里的服务员，便惊慌的走开了。

sentences.english: He might go of his own movement, but wouldn't be dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 他可以自动走开，但不能被撵走。

sentences.english: I put the pot on the gas-oven, and got away.
sentences.chinese: 我把壶放在煤气灶上，然后就走开把这件事忘掉了。

sentences.english: Feeling he was not wanted, he walked away looking embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得没趣，只好讪讪地走开了。

sentences.english: I used to busk, but I was always being moved on by the police.
sentences.chinese: 我以前常在街头卖艺，但警察总是命令我走开。

sentences.english: When she drives away, I’ll have only the baby left.
sentences.chinese: 当她走开时，我身边只剩下一个小女儿了。

sentences.english: Captain Gordon was hurried off before I walked to him.
sentences.chinese: 在我走向戈登上尉之前，他就匆匆走开了。

sentences.english: Lady Furness left us and we began to talk .
sentences.chinese: 弗内斯勋爵夫人走开了，我们交谈起来。

sentences.english: He excused himself for a moment, then came back with mobile phone in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他致歉走开了片刻，回来时手里拿着手机。

definition: to leave
to escape/to flee/to run away
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
to turn one's head/to turn around
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to wave (one's hand)
to leave/to exit
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to get out of the way/to step aside
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to stand up
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
variant of 答理[da1 li5]
